history.content:
The Berkeley Entrepreneurs Association is launching  StEP, the largest-ever program for Entrepreneurship at UC Berkeley. This course will be the first step into entrepreneurship for technical and business students and bridges the gap between Haas, Berkeley Engineering, and CS students like you on campus! The course is designed as a speaker series where each lesson will be delivered by a featured speaker. We will host entrepreneurs, VCs, and UC Berkeley faculty. We will match each team with a mentor. While some of the work will happen within the classes, we expect teams to work hard to accomplish their weekly milestones. The program is a 10-week experiential course where students will form a team, identify a problem, run customer interviews, design a solution, build a prototype, and create a startup. After completion of the program, you'll be ready to apply to incubators and accelerators around Berkeley and the Bay Area.
StEP is holding info sessions! (pizza will be provided). RSVP: https://bea.berkeley.edu/register.
- Thursday, 1/24 at noon @ Soda 606
- Monday at 6PM, and Tuesday at 7:30PM 
Moreover, the application process for StEP is now open to both teams and individuals, with or without an idea. Application will be closed on Feb 1.
history.subject: New StEP program for founders and entrepreneurs
